name: nphysics
tagline: 2 and 3-dimensional rigid body physics engine for Rust.
body:
About nphysics
========
**nphysics** is a 2 and 3-dimensional physics engine for games and animation.

Examples are available in the [examples2d](https://github.com/sebcrozet/nphysics/tree/master/examples2d) and  [examples3d](https://github.com/sebcrozet/nphysics/tree/master/examples3d) directories. There is also a short
(outdated) demonstration video [there](http://youtu.be/CANjXZ5rocI). Feel free to ask for help and discuss features on the official [users forum](http://users.nphysics.org).  

## Features
- Static and dynamic rigid bodies.
- Common convex primitives: cone, box, ball, cylinder.
- Concave geometries build from convex primitives.
- Stable stacking.
- Island based sleeping (objects deactivation).
- Ray casting.
- Swept sphere based continuous collision detection.
- Ball-in-socket joint.
- Fixed joint.

For more, check out the documentations of the two variants of the library:
* [nphysics2d](doc/nphysics2d), for the 2d physics engine using 32-bit floats.
* [nphysics3d](doc/nphysics3d), for the 3d physics engine using 32-bit floats.

Double-precision floating point numbers may be enabled using the `f64` feature.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
